decks.notes: The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with disruptive creatures like Deathrite Shaman and Collector Ouphe, while also utilizing powerful spells like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Force of Will to control the game. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and powerful threats, the deck aims to apply pressure while keeping the opponent on the back foot. The inclusion of versatile cards like Abrupt Decay and Assassin's Trophy allows for answers to a wide range of threats, making it a flexible and adaptable deck in the Vintage format.

This deck focuses on using control elements and powerful spells to outmaneuver and outplay the opponent. With a combination of counterspells, card draw, and powerful artifact mana, the deck aims to control the game until it can set up a game-winning combo. The inclusion of Gifts Ungiven and Lórien Revealed allows for efficient tutoring and selection of key cards, while cards like Underworld Breach and Brain Freeze provide a powerful finisher. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The deck revolves around using control elements to disrupt opponents while utilizing card advantage and out-valuing them through efficient spells and creatures. It focuses on playing a long game, managing resources carefully, and staying ahead on card advantage with powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck also has a strong mana denial plan with Wasteland and Strip Mine, keeping opponents off their key resources. Overall, it aims to control the game and grind out victories through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to generate card advantage and mana, allowing for explosive turns and combo potential. It includes powerful Vintage restricted cards like Black Lotus and Ancestral Recall, along with a strong counter package and interaction suite to protect the combo. The deck also includes efficient mana acceleration like Moxen and Tolarian Academy, as well as cantrips like Brainstorm and Gitaxian Probe to dig for combo pieces. Lurrus of the Dream-Den acts as a valuable companion, providing recursion for key cards. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful plays.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. It aims to maintain a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Psychic Frog while utilizing powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Demonic Tutor to dig for key pieces. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the player to continuously recur low-cost permanents. This deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents by carefully managing resources and making calculated plays.

The deck focuses on generating card advantage and controlling the game through powerful spells and artifacts. It heavily relies on efficient mana production with various Mox cards and mana rocks, while also utilizing tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor to find key pieces. The deck has access to powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Balance, and Time Walk to generate advantage, while also having disruptive elements like Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game. The win condition revolves around cards like Tinker, Bolas's Citadel, and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain to close out the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of counterspells, removal, and disruptive planeswalkers like Dack Fayden and Oko, Thief of Crowns. The key strategy revolves around utilizing Oath of Druids to cheat out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while also leveraging card advantage through cards like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise. The inclusion of cards like Strip Mine and Wasteland helps disrupt the opponent's mana base, while cards like Brainstorm and Stock Up provide additional card selection and manipulation to ensure consistency in drawing into key pieces for the deck's game plan.

This deck focuses on creating explosive and game-winning plays by utilizing cards like Paradoxical Outcome to generate massive card advantage and mana advantage. The goal is to quickly assemble powerful combinations of artifacts and spells, while also having protection and disruption with cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional versatility and recursion to the deck, allowing for extra value and consistency in executing its combo strategy.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disruption, card advantage, and efficient removal to control the game. It utilizes powerful vintage cards like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Demonic Tutor to stay ahead on resources and disrupt opponents' game plans. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect its game plan. Additionally, it has access to efficient removal in Fatal Push and Wasteland to handle threats on the board. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and dictate the pace of play through its powerful spells and disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing hatebears to disrupt the opponent while deploying aggressive threats to quickly close out the game. By combining disruptive cards like Trinisphere, Chancellor of the Annex, and Archon of Emeria with efficient creatures like Anointed Peacekeeper and Clarion Conqueror, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. The deck also relies on powerful mana acceleration from fast mana artifacts like Black Lotus, Sol Ring, and Moxen to quickly establish a board presence. Additionally, the deck includes hate cards like Chalice of the Void and Wasteland to further disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck aims to control the game through a combination of countermagic, disruption, and card advantage. By utilizing powerful spells like Force of Will, Mana Drain, and Gifts Ungiven, the deck can efficiently control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With the addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck gains additional value and resilience. The deck also includes powerful mana acceleration in the form of Moxen and other fast mana sources to quickly cast game-winning spells like Time Walk and Ancestral Recall.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving cards like Tinker, Time Vault, and The One Ring to generate a strong advantage and potentially win the game quickly. The deck also includes key artifacts like Moxen and Sol Ring to ramp up mana production and powerful counter spells like Force of Will to protect its combo pieces. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Grim Monolith and Paradoxical Outcome to draw cards and generate additional resources, allowing for more consistent execution of its combo strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, disruption, and card advantage. It utilizes powerful spells like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Demonic Tutor to stay ahead while using cards like Force of Will and Mana Drain to protect its gameplan. The deck also includes cards like Hullbreacher and Tinker to generate value and threats on the board. In addition, the deck features a Time Vault combo with Voltaic Key to win the game quickly once the control and disruption plan is established.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's plans by countering spells, destroying their lands, and removing their threats while generating card advantage for yourself. With a mix of powerful spells and efficient creatures, you aim to control the game tempo and hit your opponent's life total gradually. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a valuable companion, allowing you to recur low-cost permanents from your graveyard and maintain card advantage throughout the game. Overall, the deck excels in outmaneuvering your opponent and staying ahead in the resource game.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with powerful artifacts like Moxen, Mana Crypt, and Sol Ring to play threats like Nettlecyst, Grim Monolith, and Scrawling Crawler. The main win condition is to assemble the Time Vault + Voltaic Key combo to take extra turns. The deck also utilizes Karn, the Great Creator, Mystic Forge, and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain to control the board and disrupt opponents. Overall, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast mana, efficient threats, and disruptive abilities to win the game quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various forms of disruption, such as counter spells, removal, and resource denial like Wasteland and Strip Mine. The deck utilizes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Demonic Tutor to gain advantage and sculpt the game to its advantage. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds an additional layer of consistency and recursion to the deck. Overall, this Dimir Control deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents through careful decision-making and strategic resource management.
